1: This xls file is template for period present within the indicator.

An activity can have multiple result, these result can have multiple indicator,each of which can further have multiple periods. Thus, uploading period requires 
creation of an identifier which uniquely identifies the period and associates it with indicator. This unique identifier are later used to map subelements of period.

Please use the following format to create unique identifier for the period:

[ indicator identifier ] _ [period code]

Result identifier must contain the identifier of result that is already present in the IATI Publisher. Indicator code must contain alphanumeric values only. 
Indicator code containing symbols will be deemed invalid. 

Please be aware that reusing the indicator identifier that already exists in IATI Publisher updates the existing indicator.

An indicator similarly have multiple targets and actual subelements, and each of these subelement can have multiple document links.Thus, the unique identifier `Target Identifier` and `Actual Identifier` are used.

Please use the following format to create unique identifier for period target:

[ period identifier] _ t-[target code]
[ period identifier] _ a-[actual code]

Period identifier must be one of the identifier created in period mapper. 
Target code must contain alphanumeric values prefixed by 't-'. Target code containing symbols will be deemed invalid. 
Actual code must contain alphanumeric values prefixed by 'a-'. Actual code containing symbols will be deemed invalid.

The xls file is divided into multiple sheets based on the complexity of subelements present within result:

- The `Period Mapper` sheet contains list of indicator identifier representing the indicator and list of unique identifiers that represents the period within the indicator. Please fill this sheet carefully 
and create indicator identifier for all the indicators you wish to upload.

- Sheet `Target Mapper` contains the period identifier along with unique identifier for target.

- Sheet `Actual Mapper` contains the period identifier along with unique identifier for actual.

- Sheet `Period` contains the attributes and subelements of period excluding target and actual.

- Sheet `Target` contains the attributes and subelements of target excluding document link. 

- Sheet `Target Document Link` contains the subelement document link of the indicator. These are linked to target using target identifier.

- Sheet `Actual` contains the attributes and subelements of target excluding document link. 

- Sheet `Actual Document Link` contains the subelement document link of the indicator. These are linked to target using actual identifier.

The columns in the XLS are colour coded based on their ability to reoccur within period or its subelement.

 Please be careful that the reoccurance are calculated based on their parent which can either be period or a sub-element within period.

These relations are defined based on official documentation provided by IATI with minimal changes. The color codes are as follows:

The columns are named in relation to their parent sub-elements if they have any. Example to this is `Comment Language` of target. Here, `Comment` is subelement to target and `Language` is the 
name of the subelement present within `Comment`, hence forming the column name `Comment Language`. 

Since, the subelement target, actual, target document link and actual document links are placed separately, the columns within these do not have their parent sub-element name explicitly prefixed to the column name, but these columns
still represent the attributes and subelements present within them.

Please note that any field with suffix narrative represents the narrative subelement, and the language field following it represents the language subattribute within that narrative.
Please look into such relationship carefully to make complete and correct use of colour code since the colour coded relationship apply based on the immediate parent of the field.
The fields that occur multiple times can be filled by using multiple rows.
Please do not edit the name of the sheets, column and column placement during the upload of result in IATI Publisher. These changes can cause xls file to be invalid.
Sheet `options` contains the codelist that are used in the creation of dropdown field throughout this xls file. Please do not edit this sheet, as it might cause your data to be invalid.
Please do not attempt to copy the values into the sheet from external sources. Fill the sample file and upload it to the system.
